div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Nov. 25, 1893. AN OFFERING FOR THE KOSCIUSKO EXPOSITION(Correspondence)

body.p: The secretary of the Polish Central Committee, formulated to stimulate the attendance of American Poles at the Lwow Exposition, received a letter from Mr. A. Schreiber, secretary of the C. Pulaski Society in Brooklyn, in which a check was inclosed for $4.45, which was contributed by nineteen persons in sums of from five to fifty cents, to aid the fund for building a Polish American pavilion.
The members of the C. Pulaski Society are to be commended for their action.
If all of our Polish societies here in America did likewise, then we would have no further worries about the Polish-American pavilion at the Lwow Exposition.
